author: ventup.io
title: Community Launchpad & DEX
description: New projects lack initial liquidity and fail to compete based on the value they generate.

assessments.note:
A launchpad and DEX built on Cardano is something that existing and new users would appreciate; it certainly would benefit adoption.

However, it lacks detailed information on what the proposal is truly about. It appears that this is not built on Cardano initially (only a migration will happen in Q3) which warrants a deduction.

The described IDO launchpad and DEX does address the challenge objectives which is to create Dapps adding value to Cardano Blockchain. The brief does explain the lacks in existing services that the project wants to address unfairness, lack of transparency, unengaged community and complexity. However, the description lacks details on how the project will bring a solution to these problems.
This project starts on Ethereum then migrates to Cardano. How will be certain that you will migrate to Cardano providing this community the ultimate value?

This proposal offers a DEX as a launchpad for a token's IDO to help new projects acquire liquidity in their early stages. Which is a good idea if performed correctly. Unfortunately there is no plan on how to realise this.

The problem description makes sense and is reasonable. The proposal for a Launchpad + DEX is within the requirements for this challenge, however the absence of goals and metrics makes it impossible to assess the impact of the proposal in this challenge. In addition, the plan presented(attached file) is only a draft and doesn't describe enough details for the implementation of the proposal, which makes impact assessment difficult.

The proposal claims to offer a inclusive, transparent, secure solution. However, no technical/other measures to ensure security and fairness are proposed. In DEX and another token presale, the importance of security is of primary importance.

A platform to support random token launches on Cardano does not provide use to as many people as possible, but rather use to a few people that want to make money by pushing out new tokens. It will rather harm the majority of the community. The ventup.ip homepage offers "Project ratings" which is not further explained, but which, if it refers to the catalyst process, is totally problematic and unacceptable.

From the information provided, this proposal seems in the early stage of ideation: from the commercial slides available (the only attached document) it seems they want to compete with Catalyst. They want to do many great things but they never say how so as it is now, this proposal is just an idea without any concrete path to reality. If they could achieve all their claims it would have a very positive impact for sure but the team needs to go way further than providing a promotional slide deck to get seriously considered for funding.
No verifiable information about the team is presented. The outlined plan is too broad to get a sense of a clear direction; thus, I deem the likelihood of success to be very low.

Catalyst requested budget is 35k$, but we lack information on how this budget will be used and what extra resources are needed to complete the project (Ventup.io claims it received a 100k$ raise for this project). We also lack details on the team composition and experience. Showing previous realization or experiences would help the community to assess the chances of success of the project. Also adding more details on the specific algorithms that will solve the "IDO fairness" issue would add value to the project description.
I give a 1 for feasibility because so little information is given. It is very unclear what works need to be done and whether it would be feasible. Very little detail given for the work ahead.

There is no team mentioned to determine if they are up for the task other than very vague functions without proof. There is mention of an 'inclusive, transparent, secure solution', yet not elaborated to clarify what this solution might be. The plan to conceive all this is not present in the proposal other than a rudimentary roadmap. To improve this, the proposal should contain that information.

The team described experiences in areas and roles related to:

Product management, Cybersecurity Experts, Full Stack Engineers, Blockchain / Cryptocurrency Experts

There is no information available to substantiate these allegations of expertise, so it is not possible to indicate the team's ability to execute the proposal.

There is no solid and structured plan for implementation. There is no budget breakdown.

Considering the fact that the proposal is for the creation of a Launchpad (a project that will essentially evaluate other projects in detail, create ratings, anti-scam features and report this to users) it was to be expected that this proposal itself would be a example of what to expect of due diligence from the proposed Launchpad, but the team failed to conduct due diligence of their own proposal, which is a worrying sign.

I recommend submitting a new proposal based on the Catalyst documentation.
The proposers have provided a working website however no other details regarding their experience and role is enclosed in the proposal.

The proposal is very minimal, and the litepaper posted with it only gives a couple of short sentences and keywords, some of which are open to interpretation. Some research of the proposers is possible, however they don't seem to have the skills to realize such a project. Some research showed that they are trying to hire for the project, which is something that should be communicated transparently in the proposal.

A lot of experience is claimed but there is no external links to back this experience (LinkedIn, GitHub, etc...). The budget is not explained at all, there is no cost breakdown. No technical specification. We know their intent but we don't know if they can nor how they plan to do it...
Their website gives a little bit more information: you can find the LinkedIn profile of the company (VentFinance) and the profiles of its founders which do corroborate the claimed experience while this prevent a 1 star rating in this category, the lack of technical details prevents me from going beyond a score of 2. The team needs to provide concrete technical information and a detailed plan so we can see if it actually makes sense on the technical side (reality).

The timeline breaks down a MVP (not on Cardano) which is not specified, a migration in Q3, and the release of a version 2 in Q4, which is also not specified. How is the budget allocated?

Too much information is missing. This proposal will be difficult to audit.

Milestones of the project development are defined for the coming year, with a prototype to be launched on Ethereum blockchain shortly before migration to Cardano. It's a very weak description of the roadmap. It would help the community to better assess the progress of the project if the proposer could add more information about the features that will be added at the different steps of development, more information on the feature that will make the difference, with an evaluation of the added value of each feature.
I give a 1 for auditability because ZERO KPIs are listed.

There is simply not enough information present in the proposal to properly asses it. 
The project has a great website containing lots of information, but sadly it is not included in the proposal. Nor is critical information, like a funding breakdown and risk assessment from that website mentioned. It needs some work to make clear to the community what this project is all about. You have the material, just including it would greatly increase the quality of this proposal.
Please detail how this proposal meets the challenge. What are you delivering? Where is the evidence you have the ability to deliver? Milestones?

The only audit information described is a roadmap, where it is defined:

-Token sale and Launch of the MVP on the Ethereum blockchain in Q2.
-New Functionality Release and Migration to Cardano in Q3
-Release of Ventup 2.0 and Beta-Release VentSwap in Q4

This roadmap is extremely subjective, as it describes the delivery of a DEX that has no plan in detail, an MVP on another blockchain that is totally against the interests of the Cardano community (what is the purpose of Cardano's treasury in financing the development of a project which will be launched on Ethereum? I don't believe this is positive for Cardano, but it is not clear whether this is included in the budget for this proposal (there was no budget allocation details) or is just an item that is already being developed and will be funded otherwise.

I recommend that the team clarify the point mentioned above and describe a plan according to the Catalyst documentation.
There is no clear roadmap and how the project is likely to be executed by the team. The team size and their capability are also not deductible from the proposal.
The milestones are very unspecific, so it will be difficult to track them. No rationale for the budget is provided.

They don't provide concrete Key Performance Indicators to measure their success. As said in previous notes they need to define their project on the technical side so that we can assess its feasibility and viability. So as it is now there is no way to audit the progress: it either succeeds completely or it fails completely. Since there is a team of experienced people (according to their LinkedIn profiles which are not even linked in the proposal) we at least have a list of accountable people but this is not enough. We need more details. It feels like they are not taking their Catalyst application seriously...

solution: All-in-one ecosystem from activating a project community to token launch and swap. We offer a inclusive, transparent, secure solution.
experience:
\- Technology Architects

\- Product Managers

\- Cybersecurity Experts

\- Full Stack Engineers

\- Blockchain / Cryptocurrency Experts
